result.reason: Java AWT/Swing has its own focus model that conflicts with Win32 SetParent embedding — keyboard events aren't forwarded to the embedded TigerVNC Java window because Java intercepts WM_SETFOCUS differently than native apps.
result.approach: After SetParent embedding, explicitly call SetFocus/SendMessage(WM_SETFOCUS) on the Java child window handle, and/or install a low-level keyboard hook (WH_KEYBOARD_LL) to relay WM_KEYDOWN/WM_KEYUP to the embedded Java HWND when it is the active connection.
